item.title: Overview
item.description:
The goal is parsing different files (no error handling on format), and providing some statistical result based on the file.

The table below is from the design document, but also detials my personal notes

To identify who the home team is, we know that the second and fourth columns contain the playing teams. Below is the column names
<DATE> <TEAM 1> <TEAM 1 SCORE> <TEAM 2> <TEAM 2 SCORE> <FLAGS> <OPTIONAL INFO>

If I need to confirm my results, I can probably write this in pandas afterward. Plus this would make fun graphs
Simply grabbing the second column as the second token, means we can't parse-multi word team names To resolve this, I think I can just check if the next token is a string or number primitive. Then I just process as normal as long as I can keep track of the new column offset in relation to the tokens
If there is a home team in the game, we know that if there's an @. That is just line based processing.
The date is also not seeming to be important.
The program seems straight forward, so I think I'll just use the exact proposed main format.
main(){ file = check(output('Whats the filename')) # above checks and reruns until a valid file is given with a while loop printHeader(file) # This just takes the header data = analyse(file) # This runs the analysis, there will be submethods in this, only one more level deep though. Outer and inner for loop log(data) } CopyRun
